You earn a medal for simply getting a kill with a specialist weapon, but this week it is abilities and you'll earn a medal essentially the same way. For example: You'll earn a medal for getting a kill while kinetic armor is active, kill someone hit by your heat wave, killing someone shortly after breaking from active camo, etc.

I would recommend running Rapid Fire, Grip, and Quickdraw or Extended Mags. Hope you like the weapon and good luck getting Dark Matter!

70% of the time of me doing Dark Matter was like this, but after almost a year break of playing I get back on and start going for DM again after about a month. I don't know if I just got WAY better or what, but I didn't have to worry about Chameleon camo anymore. Heck, my final Combat Knife challenge was the Survivor medals. The only tips I can give is to, contrary to popular believe, count your kills and of course play extra cautious when you are one or two kills away. Don't be afraid to even camp in one spot for a super long time if you know it will eventually net you kills. My biggest tip is to play Safeguard. Getting Bloodthirsties in this mode is so easy; all you need to do is lurk around the spawns and it's just stupidly easy compared to other modes. All in all, yes, I had the exact same problem as you, but over time it really did diminish. Good luck on your Dark Matter and never give up!

If his power strength is 115% default at max rank without mods, then it doesn't really make any difference. It's still basically 100% power strength since that's without any mods. The additional 15% doesn't matter at all since it's just his base stats.

But the 15% doesn't make any difference whatsoever because it's a part of his default, unmodded stats. The point of using mods is to increase power strength above the baseline; his baseline is still a number, just listed as 115%. Therefore, the mods are still improving that number labeled as 115%, same as they would with any other Warframe labeled as 100%. It makes no difference since it may say 115%, however it's still his baseline without any mods.

50 years, torture, and castration? It #8217;s undeniable that what he did was terrible and disgusting, and he needs to be punished, but shouldn #8217;t we be focusing on bettering a person rather than essentially sentencing them to life imprisonment over one mistake? Yes, as you said, it #8217;s likely he may try and do it again, but the world would be better off if he was able to change and become an upstanding member of society, no?

Of course not, but what I just wrote out is that we should be focusing our efforts and changing him so that #8217;s he #8217;s not a pedo, not leaving him to rot for the rest of his life over one stupid mistake he made.

First off I called it a mistake, not an accident. A mistake because it #8217;s something he obviously shouldn #8217;t have done, that he #8217;s now being punished for. Yes, I agree with you that anyone who sexually abuses anyone, child or not, should be harshly punished. However, you said he #8217;s showing the first warning signs, and I agree, BUT, can you name a single downside to taking action right now to try and help this man change his life around? I don #8217;t know the details of rehabilitating pedophiles other than some broad knowledge I #8217;ve learned through studying psychology, but I do know that some countries have an emphasis on criminal improvement and as such have an astoundingly high criminal turnover rate. Perhaps I #8217;m wrong, and I think it #8217;s a hard decision to make. In the ideal scenario he spends time in prison then completes rehabilitation and lives the rest of his life as a good man. On the other hand he could one day commit rape and then be thrown into jail for the rest of his life. Anyway I just hope his man realizes what he #8217;s down, feels remorse, and strives to be better. Yet, some men simply don #8217;t care and feel nothing.

WRITING.TITLE: This series was such an amazing part of my life.
WRITING.TEXT: Hey all, I #8217;m new here, but I just wanted to write down some thoughts. Moments ago I was just chilling on YouTube watching some videos of Assassin #8217;s Creed Odyssey, then I was suddenly flooded with thoughts of Greek mythology and then this series. Whenever I tried to think about what my favorite book series was, I somehow always forgot about this one. Never, has any series, be it a book, show, etc, captivated and immersed me so much in a world. While I read these books, I truly felt like I was *there*. Many books have done that, but none have as strong as this series has. I started reading PJ in elementary school; I #8217;m now since graduated. I remember loving The House of Hades so, so very much because it was essentially a book featuring just Percy and Annabeth, and I loved their relationship. I also remember staying up all night to finish The Blood of Olympus in one sitting. All in all, I forgot about this amazing series for quite a while, and I #8217;m glad I could share my thoughts. Let me know if you guys have any similar feelings. Now, if you #8217;ll excuse me, I am definitely going to go find my copy of The Lightning Thief.

WRITING.TITLE: Questions about HRT (MtF)
WRITING.TEXT: Realized I was trans 2 months ago and 90% of the time present male in public for background. I really want to start HRT, more than anything and I #8217;m wondering how I begin the process. I #8217;ve heard of some people going through Planned Parenthood and there is one about 5 minutes from where I live. Also, I kinda hate needles, so is there a difference between getting tablets and injections? Lastly, as I said I mostly present male because I live with family who I #8217;m not sure would understand me coming out, so if I started HRT, do you think they would notice what #8217;s up and how long until they begin to notice? Sorry if this is a lot, I #8217;m just learning so much about myself and want to do all I can right now to finally be at peace with my body. Thanks so much for reading and any help you can give! lt;3
#8220;I #8217;m my own grandpa... #8221;

Yep. When I first started going vegan, my dad asked why I wouldn #8217;t eat this one food. So I told him that I just can #8217;t support what happens to the animals and if he knew, neither would he. He then told me he knew what happened. In his mind, I think he believed that animals just deal with living in crowded farms, then they #8217;re humanely killed; not that hundreds of male baby chicks are dumped into an industrial blender each minute, or that calves are stolen from their mothers (who have been raped), then later killed. There are people out there who truly *refuse* to accept that eating animals is wrong. I got into an argument in a Discord server because people were talking about how delicious lamb is, so out of anger I sent a picture of a cute little lamb and said that #8217;s what is being slaughtered for their taste buds. They got SUPER defensive and petty, just repeating how tasty it is with the drooling emoji.

Yep, we read the chapter about the slaughterhouses in history a few years ago. The sad truth is that those same practices still happen to this day. Watch the documentary Dominion if you #8217;d like to see where your food comes from. Really horrifying stuff.

Thankfully that #8217;s been done away with (as far as we know lmao), but it #8217;s still a disgusting industry. Many people probably believe eggs are a relatively harmless product, as they think no animals are directly killed, however the truth is that since mail chicks are useless to the egg industry, they #8217;re loaded onto a conveyor belt moments after birth, and dumped into a giant blender. Male cows often get clamps tightened around their testicles, until they rot and fall off as a means of castration. Females are raped and have their babies stolen, killed for veal. Pigs have a tendency so go insane and cannibalism each other. Milk also has trace amounts of blood and pus in it. I haven #8217;t even scratched the surface - just so really horrible stuff. As I mentioned in my original comment, give *Dominion* a watch if you #8217;re interested, but it #8217;s very graphic.
Of course, they #8217;re always loved and live happy lives on my uncle #8217;s local farm

And I know I could not nor would ever do that. It #8217;s weird how much we can change; I can #8217;t believe I wanted to go hunting with my uncle when I was younger. I #8217;m so glad I never did. The thought actually makes me want to vomit now.
As a fellow trans girl seeing these comments warms my heart. You #8217;re all wonderful people, truly lt;3

I enjoy the sequels but they break so many things in the universe of Star Wars. Leia flying? Why didn #8217;t Jedi just superman everywhere and to get out of danger? Hyperspace ramming speaks for itself; they could just had unmanned ships ram literally everything at light speed, even if they tried to retcon it in TROS. Then force healing. It #8217;s fine in The Mandalorian because we assume Yoda #8217;s species is *especially* force sensitive AND he healed like a very small flesh wound if I remember. Meanwhile Rey heals a lightsaber wound that went straight through Ben #8217;s chest, and he brings her back from the dead, albeit at the cost of his own life. It just ruins the immersion because it introduces these very powerful abilities into the universe which makes us wonder why previous characters didn #8217;t use them. I #8217;m sure the sequels aren #8217;t the first time this has happened, not even in Star Wars, but the implications for the types of power it introduced are broken.

Yeah no Kylo #8217;s abilities are cool as hell and I meant only what I mentioned ruined it for me. My dad often likes to point out how convenient it is that every console on every planet for every purpose uses the same universal connection R2 has. It #8217;s like if we used USB for literally *everything* . Force Speed was used in a pretty minor way, however it does still break things. Obi-Wan could #8217;ve used it to zoom through the lasers in the end. My problem is that when each power I mentioned in the sequels is used, it plays a PIVOTAL role in the fate of the heroes. Leia, Rey, and Kylo directly use the force to save either themselves or someone else; Holdo uses the light speed ram to save the Resistance.

Why are you getting offended? It could be a copypasta because so many people share the same opinions; the sequels introduced a decent amount of superpowers that seemingly break the Star Wars universe. I don #8217;t see the problem with me pointing that out, regardless of if someone has done so before? I #8217;m not salty at all, I like and enjoy the sequels, just not a fan of some of its decisions.

That #8217;s a good point, didn #8217;t think of that. While there *is* gravity in space, it #8217;s just felt to a much, much smaller extent than on Earth. But space is still a vacuum so there #8217;s no air resistance, so I guess that explains it?

I would like to correct you by saying dairy and eggs absolutely *do* cause harm to living beings. In the egg industry, male chicks are useless so moments after birth, they #8217;re loaded onto conveyor belts at the end of which is a funnel with a giant industrial blender at the bottom. Hundreds of baby chicks per minute are blitzed into unrecognizable red paste simply because they #8217;re deemed worthless. In the dairy industry, the mothers are locked into stalls made only just big enough for them to fit in, so they cannot move an inch. They #8217;ll live most of their lives with metal contraptions fixed to their udders for milking, which often causes infections, resulting in blood and pus ending up in the milk. They #8217;re then raped multiple times per year to produce the maximum amount of milk. When they give birth, their calves are immediately stolen from them and slaughtered for veal and the mother will scream/cry for a couple of days in anguish. She #8217;ll give birth a couple times each year, which is WAY more than is healthy, and this is repeated every year until she is too frail to live, then she #8217;ll be ground up into meat. While I #8217;m sure all of us at some point have envisioned dairy and eggs coming from a nice farm where they treat the animals well and milk them by hand with a bucket, that #8217;s not true. Dairy/Egg farming today is industrialized where each living animal is seen as nothing more than an object. I know no one wants to hear this, but I wanted to make clear that dairy and eggs still result in an immense amount of suffering. If you want more information, look up Dominion over on YouTube.

Yeast is definitely vegan. While I #8217;m sure there #8217;s a select few vegans out there who omit it, that #8217;d be like opting not to use hand sanitizer since you #8217;re killing the bacteria on your hand, since bacteria is technically a living organism.

Seriously. My argument now in advocating for veganism on the internet these days has boiled down into just saying #8220;Go watch Dominion. #8221; That documentary can sway far better than my words ever could. It #8217;s either you see nothing wrong with continuing to eat animals after watching it, in which case something would have to be seriously wrong with you, or you start cutting animal products out of your life.

However for the most part compared to high school, everyone in adulthood just wants to be there for what they need to be there for, then go home.

To be fair that #8217;s because Gears of War #8217;s gameplay isn #8217;t centered around boss fights. Games like Destiny, Division, MMO #8217;s, etc., all have the main big boss in an encounter, and all the fodder enemies are referred to as adds. Someone might be focused on boss DPS while the others are on add management. In a game like Gears, these types of enemies are absolutely what defines the experiences, however no one is playing games in which the term #8220;adds #8221; is typically used to only kill adds - they #8217;re there for the raid/boss mechanics and the rewards. But yeah, Remnant is a shooter in which we essentially have infinite ammo and can kill things extremely easily, even on Apocalypse. Having only started Apoc recently, I immediately had to adapt to a more evasive playstyle since ranged enemies 2-3 shot me. Personally I think it #8217;s balanced and fun, having to be mindful of my flanks, when to shoot, and when to dodge.

Absolutely not. Sometimes my 144hz monitor will revert down to 60hz, and as soon as I boot up a game I *instantly* notice it. 60 FPS is great, but 144 is just a game changer. It #8217;s like, yeah, my mattress is fine - then you invest into an actual quality mattress, and you all of the sudden had no idea laying down could feel so good. I drive an old car from 2002 and a while back I had to drive my friend #8217;s car made in the last couple of years and it was absolutely mind-blowing how much better every single thing felt. Going from 30-60 feels insane; going from 60-144 feels freaking incredible. It #8217;s gotten to the point where things don #8217;t feel right if they #8217;re not at least ~90. However for the most part 60 is pretty fine.

Yep. Said this in another comment but sometimes my monitor will revert back to 60hz, and I #8217;ll know when it does because as *soon* as I load up a game, despite the FPS counter saying 144hz, it doesn #8217;t feel like it. Then I #8217;ll check display settings and lo and behold it #8217;s set to 60hz. The difference is incredible.

gt; Assuming you #8217;re right There is no right or wrong here. Unless you #8217;re asking me to explain the science of *why*, in which case I have no clue nor do I think it #8217;s relavent. It seems like you haven #8217;t tried out displays above 60 before, so I urge you to go try it out. Since you seem predetermined to refute a difference above 60, you might not notice a big change, or maybe you will. I, along with tons and tons of other people definitely see a huge difference when it comes to 60-144. 60 is already pretty smooth, or rather it was; 144 just cranks that smoothness up to 11 and there is no way I #8217;d ever go back.
